reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)

description.narrative: The program aims to reduce the number of hiv-infections in Ethiopia and increase understanding toward persons infected with hiv, living with aids and toward orphaned vulnerable children in the society through awareness-raising and information. Ethiopia has still about 800.000 hiv-infected persons and about one million OVCs, even if it has been able to reduce the number of new infections in the last years. The program includes training of trainers and it also serves as material producer and material center. It is implemented in wide cooperation with the state and other non-governmental organizations. The implementing agency is the Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus / Development and Social Services Commission central office (EECMY-DASSC) in Addis Ababa . It is implemented in the area of 10 synods in the whole country, and its outreach is approximately 1,5 million people yearly. The church introduced hiv/aids-work among the first organizations in the end of 1980ies and has made a decision in principle to include awareness-raising about hiv/aids.
